main event: Multiple detailed reports of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in the vicinity of Cochransville, Pennsylvania, on various dates in 1951, 1953, and 1953.
interesting points: The UFO was observed to be circular or oval, grey or white in color, and appeared to be rotating.
One report describes an aircraft with lights attached making a rapid ascent and then descending sharply at high speed, all without making any sound. The pilot then fell with the light.
Another report mentions a star-shaped UFO moving slowly in a northwestern direction without emitting any vapor or exhaust trails. It was described to look like a balloon with a light.

An observer, identified as a farmer, reported a star-shaped, orange UFO with no vapor or exhaust trails, moving slowly in a northwestern direction. The observer's reliability and experience are labeled as unknown.
There were no interception attempts, and no attempts detected by electronic equipment at the time of the sightings.
witnesses: civilian, LT. Pearson, and an unknown farmer
